boat.full_description:
Daniel G Hatcher was famous for building Solent fishing boats in the 1860s.

Just after the Second World War, 1946, she was completely rebuilt by Whisstocks at Maldon, Essex, and re-named the Young Alert. At this time, it was possible to get timber to repair old yachts, but not to build new ones. She continued under the name 'Alert' until she came into the care of Dr Tommy Wilks OBE who owned her from 1953 -63. He renamed her 'Young Alert' in 1953. He was clearly a formidable man, ex cavalry officer and local GP. There is an affectionate pen-portrait of him on the Benfleet Community Archive website. Young Alert owned by Mike Beckett 1975 - 84 and rescued from rather delapidated state.Cruised between Holland and Brittany. Owned by George Beckett from 1984
boat.name: Young Alert
boat.short_description: The Solent Smack, Alert, was designed and built by Daniel G Hatcher in the 1860's. In 1946 she was completely rebuilt by Whisstocks and renamed Young Alert. Immediately after the war it was possible to get timber to rebuild yachts but not to build new.
